Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Appellate \Ap*pel"late\, n. A person or prosecuted for a crime. [Obs.] See {Appellee}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Appellate \Ap*pel"late\, a. [L. appelatus, p. p. of appellare.] Pertaining to, or taking cognizance of, appeals. ``Appellate jurisdiction.'' --Blackstone. ``Appellate judges.'' --Burke. [1913 Webster]
{Appelate court}, a court having cognizance of appeals. [1913 Webster]
appellate adj : of or relating to or taking account of appeals (usually legal appeals); "appellate court" [syn: {appellant}]
